parameters: \pop[2]When I enter the cabin, Isaac has his back facing toward me.
\pop[2]He's staring down into a fireplace, holding that bottle of whiskey.
\pop[2]One hand, with an open palm, braces himself against the wall.
\pop[2]He turns to face me, wobbling slightly.
\pop[2]Not sure if it's from the pain, or the alcohol.
If you can give me another option, I'll take it.
\pop[2]He places the bottle down on a nearby table, smiling at me.
\pop[2]It's clear that he doesn't just mean \c[14]physical\c[0] pain, given everything that happened.
\pop[2]Being shot, and held at gunpoint by \c[10]Argus\c[0] was sure to leave an impact on \c[14]anybody\c[0].
\pop[7]I guess we're just passing time until the morning, huh?
Then we'll head back into the city, and see what happened?
\pop[2]I notice he's intentionally glossing over the drive.
\pop[2]It's fair though. He clearly has a lot going on in his mind.
We lost all reception at the city limits.
\pop[7]If you listen close, you can hear the helicopters.
Far away, sure, but they're still up in the air.
They had eyes on us since the moment we left that building.
If they wanted to chase us, they'd know \c[14]exactly\c[0] where we are.
\pop[7]They seem more interested in what's going on -inside- the city.
And that thought is both... terrifying, and exciting.
\i[3]"I bet they're celebrating in the streets right now."
\i[3]"Probably hooking up all the \c[23]zeros\c[0] with phones. A historic moment."
\i[3]"We should be cautious. It could've escalated to violence."
\i[3]"I bet they're celebrating in the streets right now."
But \c[10]Argus\c[0] isn't usually the type to allow fun.
Those choppers could be a threat.
\pop[7]You know: stay inside, or we'll see you?
Their power is \c[14]literally\c[0] slipping through their fingers.
That's when you see someone's true nature. With their back against the wall.
\i[3]"Probably hooking up all the \c[23]zeros\c[0] with phones. A historic moment."
\pop[7]Oh, you're right! I bet the world is watching it all go down.
Can you imagine? Coming together to witness the creation of unity?
I think I did something really special, Delta. Opened a lot of doors...
\pop[7]Part of me can sympathize with the leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0], though.
Stuck between red tape and ideals from past generations?
We're all tangled up in webs far greater than we realize.
\pop[7]Of course, all that sympathy disappears when I think of Klace.
I believe his vision. I wish I didn't, but I don't really have a choice?
What we did, or what we do next, could determine our fate...
\i[3]"We should be cautious. It could've escalated to violence."
People in power often show their true colors under pressure.
And correct me if I'm wrong, but \c[10]Argus\c[0] has \c[14]never\c[0] been under pressure like this.
\pop[7]So, if they wanted to? They could easily take to violence.
But you know what? I don't think they'd succeed
I think enough people are willing to fight them now.
Inspiring people to fight for your beliefs? Fight for what's right?
We're really entering an era that \c[10]Argus\c[0] won't have a stranglehold on.
\pop[7]I just hope it all ends well...
When we get back home, we'll have a \c[14]lot\c[0] to catch up on.
I hate not having reception. I feel so... vulnerable...?
Thanks for coming to see me, by the way.
I mean, we just went through a lot. You holding up alright?
\i[3]"I'm curious about what you'll do with the drive."
\pop[7]Well I'm pretty sure you could already figure it out.
I mean, you've already lived through most of it.
\pop[7]I seem to be in some type of leadership position.
They say I was a "bridge between worlds", and a "guide to the people".
That's actually how I came up with the \c[23]Hermes\c[0] codename.
Some sort of competitor to \c[10]Argus\c[0]. Their first, true, rival.
We forced innovation, and change - created competition.
\pop[7]That seemed to be enough to get the world out of its rut.
I mean, say what you want, but things have been pretty stale.
\c[10]Argus\c[0] made everybody scared of change. I never stopped believing that.
\pop[7]But their reign was never gonna be permanent, anyways.
It was only a matter of time until somebody had a vision like mine.
Because of it, I was able to think outside the box, and use my skills.
\c[10]Argus\c[0] always thought they were too big to fail.
That nobody would take them down. The chaos would be too much.
\pop[7]But because of that? They were arrogant, and easy to hack.
"Too big to fail" often goes hand-in-hand with being easy to topple.
They just don't expect anybody to do something so reckless.
\pop[7]But that's how things have been \c[14]all\c[0] throughout history.
Sitting on your throne, proud of your rule, until you're stabbed in the back.
Because at \c[14]that\c[0] point, the change could only come from within.
\i[3]"I'm curious about what you'll do with the drive."
I have to take my vision into account, you know?
I'm still worried by the fact that we aren't in touch anymore.
\pop[7]It seems like keeping the drive could cause a rift between us.
Or worst case scenario, put our lives in further danger.
But it might be the key to making my vision a reality.
\pop[7]You know, it feels like I'm holding our future in my hands.
It was honestly easier when I held the \c[14]world's\c[0] future.
This is so much more... personal. It's \c[14]crushing\c[0].
\pop[7]Have you ever been torn between what you want, and what you need?
Both sides, vying for your attention, \c[14]begging\c[0] you to give in.
If you don't choose quickly, it's enough to tear you apart.
I either destroy the drive, or keep it.
\i[3]"I think you've done enough. It's up to others, now."
Right now, all that matters, is whether it exists or not.
It's a continued threat to \c[10]Argus\c[0]' safety, and our own.
\pop[7]But the goal \c[14]was\c[0] to harm \c[10]Argus\c[0], wasn't it?
Without leaking this info, it feels like... half of a victory.
I'm right on the edge of being able to finish the job.
\i[3]"I think you've done enough. It's up to others, now."
And thanks for not being offended, alright?
I mean, there's a few unpleasant implications here.
\pop[2]That's true. He's considering a course of action that puts us in more danger.
\pop[2]But if I knew \c[14]anything\c[0] about Isaac, I knew that he'd keep us all safe.
\pop[2]Our bond is more valuable than his cause. At least, it is \c[14]now\c[0].
\pop[2]Part of me feels like I'm responsible for that.
\pop[2]Throughout this journey, everyone made it clear how much I've inspired them.
\pop[2]I feel like I've brought us together - become a common link that was lacking before.
\pop[7]It's a lot to take in, Delta. It really is.
Sometimes I wonder if I'm just destined to be alone.
Even if I destroy the drive, I can't guarantee that you won't resent me.
\pop[7]I dragged all of you into danger. I lied. I cheated \c[10]The System\c[0].
But I did it all in the name of your safety, and a better future.
\pop[7]The fact that I had to deceive you?
It's almost too much to bear...
\pop[7]My only consolation is the fact that we won.
I hope that the days ahead are enough to pay you back.
It doesn't feel like we're under their thumb anymore. We're \c[14]free\c[0].
And we can go back to Toronto, too.
\pop[7]We might be the first people in the \c[14]world\c[0] with that right.
Just like Kyron was the first \c[23]zero\c[0] to bridge the gap.
Real trendsetters. Feels pretty good, huh?
But someone had to do it, right?
\c[10]Argus\c[0] was running on borrowed time. Almost literally.
\pop[2]I nod, and decide to shift the topic back to Kyron.
\i[3]"Did Kyron ever ask you about his parents?"
\i[3]"Did Kyron ever ask you about his parents?"
\i[3]"Yeah. He wanted to know why they defected. Who they were."
\i[3]"Yeah. He wanted to know why they defected. Who they were."
But he never asked me, which is a little odd.
\pop[2]He eyes the bottle of whiskey, but decides not to take more.
When we met Kyron on the street, I recognized him.
\pop[7]No, not really. He just looked... eerily familiar.
Like, the spitting image of someone my dad used to work with.
\pop[7]I looked into it, and sure enough - it checked out.
He defected with his wife, but that's where the info stops.
\pop[7]I'm pretty sure they conceived Kyron on the colony.
Or... whatever they used to call him back when he lived here.
\pop[7]I just know that Kyron was his father's name.
And so, I decided to pass it down to his son.
As far as I'm concerned, it's just coincidence.
\pop[7]But I can't stop myself from connecting dots.
I mean, they defected, like they were running away.
A little while after, my dad was killed in that invasion.
\pop[7]Were they working against \c[10]Argus\c[0], like we are?
It's fun to think about, isn't it? Their kids, finishing the job?
But I'm sure it's just my imagination seeing things in the dark.
\pop[7]After all, \c[14]we're\c[0] the ones who create the constellations.
At the end of the day, they're just... stars.
We find things where we want to.
\pop[2]I guess it was true. This fact doesn't really change anything.
\pop[2]We would've ended up helping whichever \c[23]zero\c[0] we came across that day.
\pop[2]It's almost like that exact moment tied them to us for the long haul.
\pop[2]I \c[14]do\c[0] find it a bit interesting, though.
\pop[2]Isaac implied that \c[10]Argus\c[0] might have killed his father...?
\pop[2]I'd disregard it, but Klace's vision means assassination \c[14]might\c[0] be in their repertoire.
\pop[7]I'm gonna go back outside, and mingle with the others.
Clearing the air like this with everybody is a \c[14]big\c[0] help.
Glad that you were one of the first, Delta. I really am.
\pop[7]If we can make it through this, we can make it through \c[14]anything\c[0].
I'm looking forward to our future, you know? As a couple.
After this, I think we can start focusing on the fun things.
\pop[2]He holds out his hands, and I accept the invitation.
\pop[7]Bet I look pretty cool right now, huh?
\pop[2]He smirks, and tilts his head toward the wound on his shoulder.
\pop[7]A man who stood against the world, and won.
But even then, I'm still more proud of our bond...
\pop[7]Like I said, it'll always be my greatest achievement.
Changing the world? I just wanted us to be happy.
Now, tomorrow is nothing but a blank slate for us.
\pop[2]I lean in for a kiss, and our lips are soon locked.
\pop[2]The only witness to our passion is the dancing of the flames.
\pop[2]When he pulls back, I can see the reflection of the fire in his eyes.
\pop[2]It's enough to lure me back in for another kiss.
\pop[2]He pushes me back against the wall as it continues.
\pop[2]I can feel the warmth of the flames heat up my lower body.
\pop[2]Isaac starts to tug at my belt, but the cabin door immediately opens.
\pop[2]Dante walks in, immediately both shocked and embarrassed.
\pop[2]Isaac lets go of my belt, and we both turn to face Dante.
Just... make sure to knock next time?
Didn't mean to intrude. I was here for Delta.
\pop[3]You \c[14]sure\c[0] you don't need some more time?
\pop[2]A knock sounds at the door, and Dante enters shortly after.
\pop[3]Oh, uh. Hope I'm not interrupting anything.
\pop[4]Just pouring my heart out, I guess.
\pop[4]So you just happened to enter when I said I was going outside.
\pop[2]We laugh, and Dante takes a few steps forward.
\pop[3]You \c[14]sure\c[0] you don't need some more time?
\pop[4]We have all the time in the world, Dante.
\pop[4]Catch you by the fire, then, Delta?
